item.title: Feature Scaling
item.description: Feature Scaling in Data Science and Machine Learning Feature scaling is a technique applied to columns of data. There are two main types of feature scaling: Normalization Standardization Normalization Normalization scales all values to a range between 0 and 1. $$ X^{\prime}=\frac{X-X_{\min }}{X_{\max }-X_{\min }}$$ Standardization Standardization scales values to have a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1, typically resulting in values between -3 and +3, although values can exceed these limits in some cases.

Shivaram Kumar Jagannathan Location: Bengaluru Email: email4srk@gmail.com LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/shivaramkumarj Github: github.com/ShirakuGIT Profile Student Practitioner in Machine Learning, Statistical Modelling, Data Analytics, Data Science, Mathematical Modelling, Neural Networks, Embedded Systems, Neural Networks. Education Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech.) - Information Technology Manipal Institute of Technology, Bengaluru GPA: 8.1 Duration: Sep 2022 - Jul 2026 (Expected) Experience Data Engineer Intern Exponent Energy, Bengaluru Duration: Jul 2023 - Aug 2023 Streamlined a Kubernetes-based workflow for automated data collection and processing using Amazon EKS, reducing manual overhead by 30%.
